definition: adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)

sentences.english: In the third cart were Mulan and her sister Mochow and the adopted daughter, whose name was Coral.
sentences.chinese: 第三輛車上是木蘭跟她妹妹莫愁，還有乾女兒珊瑚。

sentences.english: That young woman is his adopted daughter and a widow.
sentences.chinese: 這位姑娘是他的乾女兒，還是個寡婦呢。

sentences.english: Sometime ago, my god-daughter brought me to Singapore River to look at lantern.
sentences.chinese: 幾個星期前，乾女兒陪我到新加坡看燈籠。

definition: lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to heave a sigh of relief
